com.tarsec.javadoc.pdfdoclet.util
Class Version

java.lang.Object
  com.tarsec.javadoc.pdfdoclet.util.Version
public final class Version
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for determining the library version and build information.

Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $
Author:
Marcel Schoen

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getName

public static java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the library.

This information is read from a properties file which is read using the classloader resource mechanism. Therefore, that version properties file must be in the classpath at the correct location.

Returns:
The library name string or "unknown", if the name information could not be determined.

getCopyright

public static java.lang.String getCopyright()
Returns the copyright information. This is a text string like: 
 Copyright Marcel Schoen (zurich) ltd., Switzerland, 2003, All Rights Reserved.
This information is read from a properties file which is read using the classloader resource mechanism. Therefore, that version properties file must be in the classpath at the correct location.

Returns:
The copyright string or "unknown", if the copyright information could not be determined.

getVersion

public static java.lang.String getVersion()
Returns the version information. This is a text string of the form "[main].[minor].[maintenance]", for example "2.0.3".

This information is read from a properties file which is read using the classloader resource mechanism. Therefore, that version properties file must be in the classpath at the correct location.

Returns:
The version string, like "2.0.3", or "unknown", if the version information could not be determined.

getBuild

public static java.lang.String getBuild()
Returns the build information. This is a text string with some detailled information about where/how/by whom etc. this library was built.

This text will be different automatically any time the JAR file is being built, while the version may still be the same.

Returns:
The build string or "unknown", if the build information could not be determined.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This method allows to run determine the version of this JAR file by using the "java -jar" command (this class is the specified as main class in the MANIFEST file).

Parameters:
args - The commandline arguments (irrelevant).

printHeaders

public static void printHeaders()
Prints the header lines to standard output.

getHeaders

public static java.lang.String[] getHeaders()
Returns the header lines to be printed as an array of Strings. This is useful for other classes, to print the output to a logfile etc.

Returns:
The version information header (5 lines, including the enclosing lines of "-"-characters).
